title: WTB - T206 EPDG John Hummel - offering $1,200 and up for card with numerical grade
author: HobokenJon

posts.post_title: WTB - T206 EPDG John Hummel - offering $1,200 and up for card with numerical grade
posts.post_content:
Bumping my previous offer by $100.

WTB — T206 EPDG John Hummel, paying $1,200 and up for a copy in a PSA or SGC holder with a numerical grade. Will also consider raw copies or slabbed cards graded "authentic." p/p f/f

Please contact me by PM.
The combined PSA/SGC total pop for this card is 10, which isn't all that rare for an EPDG back. How can it be this hard to find one? Scratching my head here . . .

[quote name="HobokenJon" post=2206552]The combined PSA/SGC total pop for this card is 10, which isn't all that rare for an EPDG back. How can it be this hard to find one? Scratching my head here . . .[/QUOTE]

I think that past sales is the key to this one. Cardtarget only lists 3 sales of that combo sice 2008 all in 2012 and two sales were the same card that sold twice.
One was an SGC 60 and the one that sold twice was a VG raw.

There also were two SGC 60 copies sold in January 2015 at one of the now-legendary Saco River auctions. Lots #117 and #118. They went so-o-o-o-o cheap.

[url]https://www.proxibid.com/asp/CatalogPrint.asp?aid=90363[/url]

those T206 prices are insane. I need a time machine.

Good luck in your hunt
